relationships.src_id: "DEFENSE ADVANCED RESEARCH PROJECTS AGENCY INFORMATION INNOVATION OFFICE (I2O)"
relationships.description: "Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency Information Innovation Office (I2O) sponsored the research under the Low Resource Languages for Emergent Incidents (LORELEI) program."
"The Low Resource Languages for Emergent Incidents (LORELEI) program includes the evaluation of the Uyghur language, an extremely low-resource language."

entities.description: "Zhang et al., 2016 is referenced as previous work in the field of word embeddings and optimization of objective functions."
"Artetxe et al., 2016 is cited as previous work in the context of optimizing word embeddings and the importance of vector length for frequency information."
"Smith et al., 2017 is mentioned as part of the previous work that influenced the optimization objective for word embeddings."
"Lample et al., 2018 introduced the CSLS metric, which is used to address the hubness problem in shared embedding spaces."
"Dinu and Baroni, 2014 are referenced in the context of the hubness problem common to shared embedding spaces."
"The Procrustes problem is an optimization problem used to align two matrices, which is central to the process described in the text."
"The CSLS metric is a cross-domain similarity local scaling metric used to address the hubness problem in shared embedding spaces."
"The English NER training data is used to train the NER model after being translated into the target language."
"The NER model is trained using the translated data and is capable of using character sequences of the target language as part of its input."
"Spanish is one of the languages used in the experiments for training the embeddings and translations."
"English is the other language used in the experiments for training the embeddings and translations."
"Word embeddings are the numerical representations of words in a vector space, which are optimized and aligned in the described process."
"Bilingual embeddings are the result of aligning word embeddings from two different languages to facilitate translation."
"The shared embedding space is where word embeddings from different languages are aligned to enable cross-lingual interactions."
"Mutual nearest neighbors are used to generate a new dictionary for refining the alignment in the shared embedding space."
"Self-learning refinement is an iterative process used to further refine the alignment in the shared embedding space."
"Translation is the process of converting text from one language to another, which is performed using the aligned bilingual embeddings."
"Nearest-neighbor search is used to find translations for each source word in the common space."
"The hubness problem is an issue in shared embedding spaces where some words become overly central, which the CSLS metric aims to address."
"Word translations are learned by performing nearest-neighbor search in the common space using the CSLS metric."
"Surface forms refer to the visual appearance of words, which the model can use as part of its input during training."
"The unit ball is a constraint where all word embeddings are normalized to lie on, allowing equal contribution to the objective."
"Frequency information is conveyed by vector length and is considered an important signal for Named Entity Recognition (NER)."
"The monolingual corpus is a large and structured set of texts in one language, used for training word embeddings."
"Named entities are specific types of words or phrases that are identified and labeled within a text, appearing less frequently in the monolingual corpus."
"Vector length is an attribute of word embeddings that can convey frequency information, important for tasks like NER."

relationships.description: "Both Zhang et al., 2016 and Artetxe et al., 2016 are cited as previous work in the field of word embeddings, indicating a shared area of research."
"Zhang et al., 2016 and Smith et al., 2017 are both referenced as previous work, suggesting a connection in the research on word embeddings."
"Artetxe et al., 2016 and Smith et al., 2017 are mentioned in the same context, indicating a relationship through their contribution to the field of word embeddings."
"Lample et al., 2018's CSLS metric addresses the hubness problem, which was identified by Dinu and Baroni, 2014, in shared embedding spaces."

entities.description: "The DARPA LORELEI program is a source of evaluation documents used for testing the model on Uyghur language."
"Uyghur refers to a low-resource language with limited monolingual and parallel resources, which is the focus of the case study."
"Mayhew et al. (2017) is a reference to previous work that is compared with the current approach in terms of results and methodology."
"Common Crawl is the source of fastText embeddings used in the model for cross-lingual tasks."
"Wikipedia is used as a source of external knowledge in various approaches, including for the Wikifier features and translating named entities."
"GloVe provides word embeddings trained on a monolingual corpus for the purpose of Named Entity Recognition (NER)."
"CoNLL languages refers to a set of languages used in the shared task of the Conference on Natural Language Learning, which is used for comparison in the study."
"Tsai et al. (2016) is referenced for their work linking words to Wikipedia entries and using entry categories as features for training language-independent NER models."
"Ni et al. (2017) is referenced for proposing a method to project word embeddings into a common space as language-independent features."
"Ammar et al. (2016a) is referenced for their work on multi-task learning across different languages by sharing parameters for knowledge transfer."
"Yang et al. (2017) is referenced for their work involving multi-task learning and knowledge transfer across languages."
"Cotterell and Duh (2017) is referenced for their work on multi-task learning and knowledge transfer across languages."
"Lin et al. (2018) is referenced for their work on multi-task learning and knowledge transfer across languages."
"Hermann and Blunsom (2014) is referenced for their work on bilingual word embeddings learned from parallel corpora."
"Chandar et al. (2014) is referenced for their work on bilingual word embeddings learned from parallel corpora."
"Zou et al. (2013) is referenced for their work on jointly trained models that combine monolingual and cross-lingual training objectives."
"Gouws et al. (2015) is referenced for their work on jointly trained models that combine monolingual and cross-lingual training objectives."
"Zhang et al. (2017) is referenced for their work on unsupervised approaches to align word embeddings by learning a mapping.("entity"
"Table 3 is the presentation of results for the Named Entity Recognition (NER) task on Uyghur language, comparing different approaches."
"The cross-lingual setting refers to the context where the model is tested on languages other than the one it was trained on, specifically applied to Uyghur in this study."
"The unsequestered set refers to the 199 annotated evaluation documents used for testing the model's performance on Uyghur language."
"Language-specific features are used in various approaches to leverage external knowledge, such as Wikipedia, for improving performance on language tasks."
"Language-independent transfer is a method of building models using features that are independent of the language, allowing for direct application across languages."
"Multi-task learning is a paradigm where a model is trained on multiple tasks simultaneously, sharing parameters to enable knowledge transfer across tasks."
"Bilingual word vectors are word embeddings that are aligned across two languages, facilitating cross-lingual tasks such as translation."
"Adversarial learning is a technique used to align word embeddings from different languages by learning a mapping that fools a discriminator."
"Self-learning is a method used to align word embeddings from different languages without supervision."
"Arabic script is the writing system used for Uyghur, which presents challenges for certain methods due to its divergence from Latin script."
"Identical character strings refer to methods that rely on common characters between languages, which is not effective for languages like Uyghur written in Arabic script."
"The self-attention mechanism is added to the neural architecture to address word order divergence across languages in the context of NER."
"The cross-lingual NER problem refers to the challenge of performing Named Entity Recognition across different languages, especially in low-resource languages like Uyghur."
"The unsupervised transfer setting refers to the scenario where models are transferred from one language to another without any labeled resources in the target language."
"State-of-the-art refers to the highest level of performance or technology that is currently achievable, which the paper's methods aim to achieve in cross-lingual NER."
"Lower resource requirements indicate that the proposed methods in the paper need fewer resources compared to past approaches for achieving competitive results in cross-lingual NER."
"BWET (bilingual word embedding translation) is an event or process described in the text, denoting the use of a hierarchical neural CRF model trained on translated data from English."
"Spanish is a language mentioned in the text where the methods outperform previous results by a large margin."
"Dutch is a language mentioned in the text where the methods outperform previous results by a large margin."
"German is a language mentioned in the text where the model does not outperform the previous best result, and the text speculates on the reasons for this."
"Mayhew et al., 2017 is an organization or group whose previous study results are compared with the current study's双语词嵌入翻译方法."
"CoNLL is the organization that provided the annotated corpus used for training the supervised models mentioned in the text."
"Ni et al., 2017 is an organization or group whose work is referenced in the context of using bilingual word embeddings in NER."
"Uyghur is a language discussed in the case study section of the text, where NER F1 scores are presented."
"English is the language from which data is translated in the study, and it serves as the source language for BWET."
"The self-attention mechanism is added to the model, and it produces the best results when used."
"The hierarchical neural CRF model is the model used for BWET, trained on data translated from English."
"Table 1 presents the results of transferring from English to other languages and comparisons with previous studies."
"Table 2 compares different ways of using bilingual word embeddings within the method."
"Table 3 presents NER F1 scores on Uyghur, comparing various approaches."
"Common space is a setting for using bilingual word embeddings, where source and target word embeddings are cast into a common space."
"Replace is a setting where original word embeddings are replaced with their nearest neighbors in the common space without performing translation."
"Translation is the proposed approach where the model is trained on both exact points in the target space and target language character sequences."
"Wikipedia is mentioned as a resource used by some approaches to provide external knowledge."
"Id.c. indicates using identical character strings between the two languages as the seed dictionary."
"Adv. indicates using adversarial training and mutual nearest neighbors to induce a seed dictionary."
"NER stands for Named Entity Recognition, which is the task for which F1 scores are reported in the tables."
"F1 refers to the F1 score, a measure of a model's accuracy used to evaluate the performance of the methods discussed."
"Unsequestered Set is mentioned in the context of NER F1 scores on Uyghur with extra resources."
"Extra Resources refers to approaches using language-specific features and resources, mentioned in the context of Uyghur NER F1 scores."

relationships.description: "BWET outperforms previous results on Spanish, indicating the effectiveness of the method on this language."
"BWET outperforms previous results on Dutch, indicating the effectiveness of the method on this language."
"BWET does not outperform the previous best result on German, leading to speculation on the reasons for this outcome."
"BWET is compared with the 'cheap translation' baseline of Mayhew et al., 2017, showing better performance."
"BWET uses annotated corpus from CoNLL for supervised results, indicating a reliance on this resource."
"BWET's approach to using bilingual word embeddings is compared to the setting applied in Ni et al., 2017 for NER."
"BWET is applied in a case study on the Uyghur language, where NER F1 scores are presented."
"English is the source language for BWET, which is the focus of the study's translation methods."
"The self-attention mechanism is added to the hierarchical neural CRF model, improving the results."
"Table 1 presents results related to BWET, showing its performance on different languages."
"Table 2 compares different approaches within the BWET method."
"Table 3 presents NER F1 scores on Uyghur related to BWET."
"The common space setting is one of the variants considered in the BWET method."

"Zhang et al., 2016 are researchers whose previous work is followed in optimizing the cross-lingual projection of word embeddings."
"Artetxe et al., 2016 are researchers whose previous work is followed in optimizing the cross-lingual projection of word embeddings."
"Smith et al., 2017 are researchers whose previous work is followed in optimizing the cross-lingual projection of word embeddings."
"Cross-lingual transfer is the process of transferring models trained in one language to perform tasks in another language."
"Self-attention mechanism is a technique used in neural networks to allow re-ordering of information within a sequence, accounting for word order differences."
"Cross-lingual projection is the process of aligning word embeddings from different languages into a shared space."
"A dictionary in this context refers to a resource that provides word pairs between languages, used for aligning word embeddings."
"Monolingual corpora are text datasets in a single language used for training word embeddings."
"Parallel corpora are text datasets that contain the same content in multiple languages, used for cross-lingual tasks."
"Wikipedia is an online encyclopedia used as a resource for cross-lingual tasks, providing parallel texts in different languages."
"Word embeddings are vector representations of words in a continuous space that capture semantic relationships between words."
"Nearest neighbors in the context of word embeddings refer to words that are closest in the vector space, used for word translation."
"Order-invariant refers to a property of a function where the output remains the same even if the input order is changed."
"Unsupervised methods are algorithms that learn patterns from data without requiring labeled training data."
"Labeled training data consists of data with annotations or labels, used for supervised learning of models."
"State-of-the-art refers to the highest level of performance or technology that has been achieved at the current time."
"A low-resource language is a language for which there is limited available data and resources for training language models."

relationships.description: "The self-attention mechanism is incorporated into the neural architecture to handle word order differences in cross-lingual transfer."
"Cross-lingual projection uses a dictionary to align word embeddings from different languages into a shared space."
"Word embeddings are learned from monolingual corpora in both source and target languages."
"Parallel corpora are one of the resources used to perform cross-lingual transfer."
"Wikipedia is used as a resource for cross-lingual transfer by providing parallel texts."

entities.description: "Guo et al. is a group of researchers referenced in the paper for their work on shared embedding space modeling."
"Zhang et al. is a group of researchers mentioned in the paper for their work on shared embedding space."
"Fang and Cohn is a duo of researchers cited in the paper for their contributions to the shared embedding space field."
"Ni et al. is a group of researchers mentioned in the paper for their work on shared embedding space."
Lample et al. are associated with a method using adversarial learning to align two embedding spaces, containing 5,000 source words and about 10,000 entries.
"Ma and Hovy is a duo of researchers whose work is referenced in the paper for their contributions to the hierarchical neural CRF tagging model."
"Yang et al. is a group of researchers mentioned in the paper for their work on hierarchical neural CRF tagging models."
"Vaswani et al. is a group of researchers known for proposing the self-attention mechanism used in this paper."
"Bi-LSTM-CRF Model is the event of introducing a self-attention mechanism to deal with divergence of word order in the paper's described model."
"Self-Attention is the event of adding a self-attention layer on top of the word-level Bi-LSTM to provide context feature vectors for each word."
"Hierarchical Neural CRF is the event of describing the model used to perform Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the paper."
"Experiments refers to the event of conducting four sets of experiments to examine the effectiveness of the proposed methods in the paper."
"English is one of the languages used in the experiments for training the model, as mentioned in the text."
"Word embeddings refer to the numerical representations of words in a vector space, a key concept in the text."
"Word translation is the process of translating words from one language to another, a significant concept in the text."
"Monolingual corpus refers to a collection of texts in a single language, mentioned in the context of the text."
"Self-attentive Bi-LSTM-CRF Model is the event of leveraging the shared embedding space for word translation in the described model."
"Figure 1 is the event of showing an example of the embeddings and translations learned with the approach trained on Spanish and English data."
"Figure 2 is the event of illustrating the Self-attentive Bi-LSTM-CRF Model."
"Character-level neural network is a component of the hierarchical CRF model that captures subword information."
"Word-level neural network is a component of the hierarchical CRF model that produces context-sensitive hidden representations for each word."
"Linear-chain CRF layer is a component of the hierarchical CRF model that models the dependency between labels and performs inference."
"Bi-LSTM refers to the bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory networks used in the character and word level neural networks."
"Viterbi algorithm is used during decoding in the context of the CRF layer."
"MLP stands for Multilayer Perceptron, used in the self-attention mechanism to obtain queries and keys."
"Queries are part of the self-attention mechanism, obtained from applying an MLP on the sequence of word-level hidden representations."
"Keys are part of the self-attention mechanism, calculated using the tanh function on the sequence of word-level hidden representations."
"Attention mask is a component in the self-attention mechanism that prevents the weights from centering on the word itself."
"Context feature vector is the output from the self-attention mechanism, providing each word with sentence-level context."
"CRF layer is part of the model that takes in the sequence of hidden representations and defines the joint distribution of all possible output label sequences."
"$\S4$ refers to a section in the text where more details about the experiments are provided."
"Target language refers to the language into which translations are made, mentioned in the context of model training and generalization."

relationships.description: "Lample et al.'s architecture is closely followed in the description of the Hierarchical Neural CRF event."
"Ma and Hovy's work is referenced in the description of the Hierarchical Neural CRF event."
"Yang et al.'s work is referenced in the description of the Hierarchical Neural CRF event."
